channel.title: Dan Patrick Show (Filtered)
channel.description: Daily DP Show episodes without C&R or Best Of clips.
channel.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 – Belichick Gets the Shaft, Mike McCarthy Introduced in Pittsburgh
item.description:
Dan thinks Bill Belichick being denied entry into the Pro Football Hall of Fame on his first ballot is a bad look. Mike McCarthy is introduced to the Steelers as their new head coach with lots of emotions.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 – Charles Barkley
item.description:
Inside the NBA commentator and Basketball Hall of Famer Charles Barkley joins Dan and discusses the nuances of Halls of Fame in light of the Belichick snub and what it means now for any other coach someone would want to put on the first ballot. He also discusses the Lakers, Lebron James, the Cavaliers, and Giannis Antetokounmpo wanting out of Milwaukee. Eli Manning will go into the Hall of Fame, but it’s mostly off beating Belichick and Brady – so what does that say? One caller has a big issue with Brooks Koepka’s return to the PGA.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 – Mike Florio, Lebron return to Cleveland?
item.description:
Dan reacts to some NBA news as Giannis Antetokounmpo wants to leave Milwaukee, while speculation swirls about the final years for Lebron James and his basketball career. Pro Football Talk’s Mike Florio joins Dan and discusses the continued controversy around the Pro Football Hall of Fame and Bill Belichick as the voting process is thrust into the public light, and where it’s gone wrong; plus, digging into the controversy between Broncos quarterback Bo Nix and what his coach Sean Payton did. Callers continue to weigh in on Belichick’s Hall of Fame snub.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 – Belichick Hall of Fame fallout continues, Sam Darnold doesn’t play with a chip
item.description:
The outrage over Belichick’s apparent Hall of Fame snub continues. Dan examines the Pro Football Hall of Fame’s statement, Tom Brady weighing in, and how this has all tarnished a celebratory moment for the NFL. Sam Darnold is the first USC quarterback in the Super Bowl, and with plenty of missteps along the way it’d be easy to say he’s looking to shut doubters up.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 - Rich Eisen, Sam Darnold
item.description:
NFL commentator and radio host Rich Eisen joins Dan, gets jealous about the Danette food spread, discusses the controversy that has consumed the Pro Football Hall of Fame in regards to Bill Belichick’s ballot, wonders what to make of the remaining NFL jobs, and how Fernando Mendoza might survive with the Las Vegas Raiders. Seattle Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold joins Dan ahead of Super Bowl LX and discusses being the first USC quarterback in the Super Bowl and his own journey across the NFL leading him from fringe roster spots to this moment, plus discussing the celebrities who have reached out to him during his ascent.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 - Yes or No on Bill Belichick, Kevin Stefanski
item.description:
Too many Pro Football Hall of Fame voters might have been overthinking the vote – Dan just wants a simple “yes” or “no” on Belichick. Atlanta Falcons HC Kevin Stefanski joins Dan and discusses his move to the Falcons, memories as a coordinator, and his wishes for both Shedeur Sanders and Dillon Gabriel to succeed.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 - NFL Coaching Carousel End Game, Cooper Flagg Dominates
item.description:
With only a couple jobs still open, Dan examines the musical chairs of the NFL coaching circle; can Mike McCarthy develop a quarterback in Pittsburgh, and what are the expectations for Jesse Minter? Cooper Flagg dominated on Thursday night, and at age 19 it looks more and more like the Mavericks are his team.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 - Larry Baer, Dianna Russini
item.description:
San Francisco Giants President and CEO Larry Baer discusses pursuits of high-profile free agents like Shohei Ohtani and Aaron Judge, and gives his thoughts on whether the Dodgers are good for baseball. The Athletic Senior NFL insider Dianna Russini previews a difficult press conference for Roger Goodell later today and shares a time she was yelled at by an NFL head coach.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 - Albert Breer
item.description:
The MMQB Senior NFL Reporter Albert Breer believes the NFL is struggling with transparency and trust, and breaks down the final picture of the NFL head coaching carousel. Plus, Dan and the Danettes give their Best and Worst of the Weekend!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 - Live from San Francisco!
item.description:
Dan Patrick and the Danettes are live overlooking the San Francisco Bay for the week leading up to the Big Game in Santa Clara! Dan reacts to the head coaching carousel coming to an end. Plus, are major announcements in store when Roger Goodell addresses the media today?

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 - Steve Young
item.description:
Pro Football HOF QB Steve Young shares what it was like playing in the Pro Bowl in decades past and backs Bill Belichick as an easy first-ballot Hall of Famer. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 - Chris Russo, Frank Caliendo
item.description:
SiriusXM Radio Host Chris "Mad Dog" Russo rattles off sports moments from years past that only he could remember and reminds everyone to not take sports too seriously. Comedian Frank Caliendo shares his best impressions and explains how mannerisms unlock voices.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 - Robert Kraft gets the Bill Belichick Treatment
item.description:
Dan Patrick and the Danettes are live overlooking the San Francisco Bay for the week leading up to the big game! Dan reacts to Robert Kraft falling short of Hall of Fame induction yet again. CBS NFL analyst Ross Tucker shares how the day after the Super Bowl became the UK's top "sick day" and flags some concerns over Drake Maye's shoulder.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 - Dan Orlovsky
item.description:
ESPN NFL Analyst Dan Orlovsky joins the show to discuss his humble beginnings as a football player, what it means to be "seeing ghosts" as a quarterback during a game, how the Patriots can come out on top in the Super Bowl, and much more! Finally, Dan and company discuss ticket prices to get into the big game. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 - Robert Griffin III
item.description:
Dan reacts to the looming potential of the NFL expanding to an 18-game season. Former Pro Bowl QB Robert Griffin III praises Sam Darnold's honesty and dismisses Drake Maye's shoulder concern.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 - Steve Kerr
item.description:
Dan Patrick and the Danettes are live in San Francisco for the week leading up to the big game! Dan reacts to the Cavaliers acquiring James Harden. Warriors Head Coach Steve Kerr shares what he learned from the legendary coaches he played under and claims no responsibility for the NBA 3-point explosion.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 - Andrew Luck, Louis Riddick
item.description:
Stanford general manager and former NFL quarterback Andrew Luck joins Dan and discusses the various struggles of navigating the modern landscape of college football and negotiating through the NIL era; he’s also mad at Paul for not deploying the Luck impersonation while he’s there. Football broadcaster and forme NFL player Louis Riddick stops in and talks about getting clowned by Jerry Rice in spite of making a big play, along with his thoughts about this Super Bowl matchup between the Patriots and Seahawks.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 - Bo Jackson, Kirk Herbstreit
item.description:
Heisman winner and athletic phenom Bo Jackson joins Dan and discusses how much he does not like golf, taking on some of the greats like Deion Sanders and Brian Bosworth, plus a candid discussion about men’s health and his own battle with cancer. Football commentator Kirk Herbstreit and his dog Peter take over the stage and Kirk discusses the strained landscape of college football, how he learned to call the game so quickly, and what he sees in Indiana quarterback and potential first overall NFL draft pick Fernando Mendoza.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 – Why isn’t Tom Brady rooting for the Patriots? Gerald McCoy
item.description:
Dan reacts to the shocking revelation that Tom Brady won’t admit to rooting for the Patriots in the Super Bowl, but is it a matter of something like jealousy or wanting Klint Kubiak for the Raiders? NFL Network analyst and Pro Bowler Gerald McCoy joins Dan to discuss dealing with fans when he was playing, memories of sacking Tom Brady and whether he sees himself as a Hall of Famer or not.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 - CeeDee Lamb, Mike Tirico & Cris Collinsworth
item.description:
Cowboys Wide Receiver CeeDee Lamb talks about the pressure every year on the Cowboys, tries to sort out the Kardashians, and is shocked to learn Dan doesn’t root for a team. NBC broadcast team Mike Tirico and Cris Collinsworth join the show and Mike talks about this being his first Super Bowl after a stellar career (and Collinsworth’s fifth), what NFL city Cris is the least popular in, and weigh in on the voting results for the Pro Football Hall of Fame and the NFL Awards.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 - Malcolm Butler, Booger McFarland
item.description:
Former Patriots Cornerback Malcolm Butler talks to Dan about making the greatest play in Super Bowl history, Robert Kraft not knowing who he was ,and what happened to the game ball from that play, as well as how he’s giving back to his Mississippi hometown. ESPN’s Booger McFarland joins Dan and discusses that Butler play and how it all happened in realm time in the last Seahawks-Patriots Super Bowl, and the fallout for both teams from Butler’s play. A Super Bowl Rhyme Time rounds out the hour.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 - MVP voting got questionable, Melissa Stark & Kaylee Hartung
item.description:
Rams Quarterback Matthew Stafford took home MVP on the slimmest of margins, with one voter explaining why he voted for Justin Herbert. Dan and the Danettes are already ruminating on the next Hall of Fame classes and the names that could be up for consideration, including Antonio Brown. NFL sideline reporters Melissa Stark and Kaylee Hartung join Dan to discuss their approach to covering Super Bowl LX.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 – Drake Maye Had No Answers, Recollections from the Road Trip
item.description:
Dan and the Danettes discuss Drake Maye and the Patriots’ offense’s inability to deal with the Seahawks’ defense. And they recap some of the highlights from their trip to San Francisco, especially for Fritzy.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 – Kicker Dominance, Ross Tucker
item.description:
Seahawks kicker Jason Myers was the story of the first half as he broke the record for most points in a single postseason and Dan thinks good kickers are an underrated advantage in the NFL. And former NFL OL Ross Tucker drops by to lend his 2-cents on Super Bowl LX.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 – Super Bowl Champion Seahawks, Bill Cowher
item.description:
Dan breaks down the Seattle Seahawks Super Bowl victory from last night including Sam Darnold’s legacy and the Seahawks’ defensive dominance. And Hall of Fame HC Bill Cowher drops by to weigh in on yesterday’s big game.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 - NFL Offseason Preview, Reggie Miller
item.description:
Dan takes a broad look at the NFL offseason, exploring the fluidity of the QB position across the league and highlighting some major storylines. Basketball Hall of Famer Reggie Miller looks back on the Malice at the Palace following yesterday's Pistons-Hornets brawl and discusses potential expansion for the NBA. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 - Mike Golic Sr.
item.description:
Dan talks with Former NFL Defensive Lineman Mike Golic Sr., who sees a more difficult schedule looming large for the Patriots and places the Seahawks' defensive performance in the same realm of the '85 Bears. Plus, the Seahawks take Disneyland, and is an NBA franchise soon to be on the move?:

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 - Redrafting 2024 QB Class, Were the Patriots a Fluke?
item.description:
On today's Dan Patrick Show, DP and the Danettes discuss how the 2026 Patriots need to prove that this season wasn't a fluke. Dan redrafts the loaded 2024 QB draft class after the strong seasons from Drake Maye and Caleb Williams. Dan talks the latest from the Winter Olympics and reflects on covering the event in the past.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 - Drew Brees
item.description:
Newly-named first-ballot Pro Football Hall of Famer Drew Brees looks back on Super Bowl memories and reflects on nearly signing with Miami over New Orleans. Plus, Dan talks the latest on the Winter Olympics.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 - The NBA's Tanking Problem, Jason Garrett
item.description:
Dan reacts to Patriots OL Will Campbell addressing the media after his struggles in the Super Bowl. Former Cowboys HC Jason Garrett questions why New England never adjusted offensively and gives his thoughts on an Aaron Rodgers reunion in Pittsburgh. Plus, the NBA has a tanking problem once again.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 - Patriots Reporter Mike Reiss
item.description:
Dan Patrick reacts to an incredible night from Victor Wembanyama. ESPN Patriots Reporter Mike Reiss shares the mood from the Patriots' locker room following their Super Bowl loss and weighs in on Tom Brady not openly backing his former team in the Super Bowl.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 – NBA’s Small Market Revolution, Big Ben Triggering Players in Pittsburgh
item.description:
San Antonio, Detroit, Oklahoma City – they’ve been proving that anyone can compete in the NBA, but does the sport remain dependent on the large markets? A Steeler pushes back against Ben Roethlisberger talking about the team.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 – Chris Mannix, Who Cares about the NBA All-Star Game?
item.description:
NBA writer Chris Mannix joins Dan and discusses the continued scourge of tanking and possible solutions, and the upcoming NBA All-Star Game that continues to change its format and struggles to get players and the fans to care about it. And the Danettes discuss why foreign players seem to have less interest in the All-Star Game.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 – NBA All-Star Tanking, Chris Simms
item.description:
Dan thinks the NBA has a big problem with tanking that Commissioner Adam Silver needs to address as teams are already sitting their stars before we’ve even hit All-Star weekend. Pro Football Talk’s Chris Simms joins Dan and talks about what the Raiders will do with Maxx Crosby, quarterback situations for teams approaching the draft, and what changes the Patriots could have made, if any, at halftime in the Super Bowl.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 – Mike Tirico, Noah Eagle
item.description:
NBC’s Mike Tirico discusses rushing from the Super Bowl straight to Milan for the Winter Olympics, and all the stories that have come out of the games – plus the support network he has for pronouncing all those names correctly. Noah Eagle talks to Dan about being the youngest to call the NBA All Star Game, what advice he’s been given through his career, and his thoughts on tanking in the NBA and if there’s any way to handle it.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 – John Harbaugh, Valentine’s Day Advice
item.description:
New York Giants Head Coach, John Harbaugh joins Dan to talk about his new team, what it’s been like after leaving the Ravens, and lessons he’s learned over the years as an NFL head coach from a coaching family. Valentine’s Day looms large for the Danettes.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 – NBA Tanking Continues, Valentine’s Day Weekend
item.description:
The Pacers and Jazz get fined for resting stars when healthy, and the problem of tanking continues to abound in the NBA. Dan is concerned there may not be a viable solution. Callers and the Danettes discuss superstitions around Valentine’s Day and other festive dates.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 1 - Better Weekend, Michael Jordan or the NBA?
item.description:
Covino & Rich are in for the great Dan Patrick! They debate who had the better weekend, Michael Jordan or the NBA? They talk the one "but" in MJ's Sunday. Was the All-Star format an improvement? The guys explain how the Dunk Contest fell on its head. Plus, Cove is bloated from meat, & there's a K-Zone debate in baseball!


#CRShow

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 2 - A Perfect Valentine's Day in 2027
item.description:
C&R are in for the DP Show on this President's Day! Super Bowl 61 has the perfect date, Steely McBeam job opening (Rich is the perfect big headed mascot.) Plus, the Titans new logo was leaked & laughter ensues!


#CRShow

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick

item.title: Hour 3 - Wait, Aliens Are Real?
item.description:
Covino & Rich are in for Dan Patrick on the holiday! Rich proclaims the G.O.A.T. movie as the winner of the weekend, over the NBA and MJ/Daytona 500! Are Mets players just "work friends?" Curling is harder than it looks. Plus, Presidential Trivia for prizes & Obama says aliens are real!


#CRShow

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Dan Patrick
